/.title: Buefy: lightweight UI components for Vue.js based on Bulma

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.subtitle: Learn everything you need to start using Buefy ;)

documentation/start.title: Start
documentation/start.subtitle: Three ways to install and use Buefy

documentation/customization.title: Customization
documentation/customization.subtitle: If you're familiar with Sass and want to customize Buefy with your own theme, follow these steps

documentation/constructor-options.title: Constructor options
documentation/constructor-options.subtitle: These are global default options, which are set on Buefy initialization

documentation/layout.title: Layout & elements
documentation/layout.subtitle: Buefy has the entire Bulma's core built in. You can use any feature from Bulma, plus all the components Buefy offers

documentation/collapse.title: Collapse
documentation/collapse.subtitle: Collapse is a easy way to toggle what you want

documentation/dialog.title: Dialog
documentation/dialog.subtitle: Dialogs inform users about a specific task and may contain critical information or require decisions

documentation/dropdown.title: Dropdown
documentation/dropdown.subtitle: Dropdowns are very versatile, can used as a quick menu or even like a select for discoverable content

documentation/icon.title: Icon
documentation/icon.subtitle: Icons take an important role of any application

documentation/tooltip.title: Tooltip
documentation/tooltip.subtitle: Display a brief helper text to your user

documentation/modal.title: Modal
documentation/modal.subtitle: Classic modal overlay to include any content you may need

documentation/tabs.title: Tabs
documentation/tabs.subtitle: Responsive horizontal navigation tabs, switch between contents with ease

documentation/toast.title: Toast
documentation/toast.subtitle: Toasts are simple text messages to inform the user

documentation/snackbar.title: Snackbar
documentation/snackbar.subtitle: When a Dialog seems a bit overkill for the task, Snackbars are good candidates

documentation/notification.title: Notification
documentation/notification.subtitle: Bold notification blocks to alert your users of something

documentation/documentation/message.title: Message
documentation/documentation/message.subtitle: Colored message blocks, to draw attention of your user

documentation/field.title: Field
documentation/field.subtitle: Fields are used to add functionality to controls and to attach/group components and elements together

documentation/input.title: Input
documentation/input.subtitle: Get user Input. Use with Field to access all functionalities

documentation/select.title: Select
documentation/select.subtitle: Select an item in a dropdown list. Use with Field to access all functionalities

documentation/autocomplete.title: Autocomplete
documentation/autocomplete.subtitle: Extended input that provide suggestions while the user types. Use with Field to access all functionalities

documentation/checkbox.title: Checkbox
documentation/checkbox.subtitle: Select a single or grouped options

documentation/radio.title: Radio
documentation/radio.subtitle: Select an option from a set

documentation/datepicker.title: Datepicker
documentation/datepicker.subtitle: An input with a simple dropdown/modal for selecting a date, uses native datepicker for mobile

documentation/timepicker.title: Timepicker
documentation/timepicker.subtitle: An input with a simple dropdown/modal for selecting a time, uses native timepicker for mobile

documentation/taginput.title: Taginput
documentation/taginput.subtitle: A simple tag input field that can have autocomplete functionality

documentation/table.title: Table
documentation/table.subtitle: Tabulated data are sometimes needed, it's even better when it's responsive

extensions.title: Extensions
extensions.subtitle: See how you can improve Buefy with other packages

extensions/cleavejs.title: Cleavejs
extensions/cleavejs.subtitle: Format input text while you type — as a Vue directive

extensions/sortablejs.title: Sortablejs
extensions/sortablejs.subtitle: Sort a table — as a Vue directive
